etymology.description: 栅(柵) (zhà, "fence; palisade") and 栏(欄) (lán, "railing; balustrade") combine to convey the concept of a structure used to enclose or separate areas, typically made of rails or posts.
etymology.interpretation: A 栅(柵) (zhà, "fence") is a basic structure for enclosure, while 栏(欄) (lán, "railing") refers to a protective barrier. Together as 栅栏(柵欄), they form a structure that can act as a protective or divisive barrier, often made of metal or wood.

examples.chinese: 工人正在修理栅栏(柵欄)。
examples.english: The workers are repairing the fence.

examples.chinese: 小猫跳上栅栏(柵欄)，继续它的冒险(繼續它的冒險)。
examples.pinyin: Xiǎo māo tiào shàng shí làn, jìxù tā de màoxiǎn.
examples.english: The kitten jumped onto the fence and continued its adventure.
